    • getOfferedItems

      @GetMapping("/offered") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.item.ItemResponseDTO>> getOfferedItems(@RequestParam String email) throws com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.EntityNotFoundException
      Displays items offered for sale by the chosen user identified by email Endpoint for authenticated users
      Parameters:
      email - as String
      Returns:
      ItemResponseDTO List ItemResponseDTO( Long itemId, LocalDate offerDate, String itemName, String itemDescription, Integer price, String sellerEmail, LocalDate purchaseDate, String buyerEmail )
      Throws:
      com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.EntityNotFoundException - if user does not exist in database. Status code 404. error message: "email not found in database"

    • addItem

      @PostMapping("/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.item.ItemResponseDTO> addItem(@RequestBody com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.item.ItemCreateDTO itemCreateDTO) throws com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.EntityNotFoundException

    • buyItem

      @PatchMapping("/buy/{item_id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.item.ItemResponseDTO> buyItem(@PathVariable("item_id") Long itemId, @RequestParam String email) throws com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.EntityNotFoundException
      Allows authenticated users to buy products
      Parameters:
      itemId - the id of the product the user wants to buy as path variable
      email - user email
      Returns:
      purchased product as ItemResponseDTO( Long itemId, LocalDate offerDate, String itemName, String itemDescription, Integer price, String sellerEmail, LocalDate purchaseDate, String buyerEmail )
      Throws:
      com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.EntityNotFoundException - if user or item does not exist in database. Status code 404. error message: "email not found in database" error message: "item not found in database"

    • deleteItem

      @DeleteMapping("/{item_id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.item.ItemResponseDTO> deleteItem(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token, @PathVariable("item_id") Long itemId) throws com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.NoAuthorizationException, com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.EntityNotFoundException
      Parameters:
      token - the token is used to verify the user. Only item owner or users with role ADMIN can delete products
      itemId - item id to be deleted
      Returns:
      deleted product ItemResponseDTO( Long itemId, LocalDate offerDate, String itemName, String itemDescription, Integer price, String sellerEmail, LocalDate purchaseDate, String buyerEmail )
      Throws:
      com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.NoAuthorizationException - status code 401 if the user has no right to modify. error message: "only item owner or user with role "Admin" can delete item"
      com.synoradzki.paymoverecruitment.exception.EntityNotFoundException - if item does not exist in database. Status code 404. error message: "item not found in database"
